newsitem.title: UK: Badminton-Hoyer-Larsen set to end lean spell.
newsitem.headline: Badminton-Hoyer-Larsen set to end lean spell.

text.p: GLASGOW, May 26 (Reuter) Poul-Erik Hoyer-Larsen, last year's All-England, European and Olympic champion, is bidding to complete the set of major badminton titles as the world championships start in Glasgow on Tuesday.

But the man who dominated in 1996 has struggled to hit form this year. The Dane has not won a tournament since his Olympic triumph in Atlanta, and has also been struggling with a toe injury that may require an operation.
The 31-year-old scored a morale-boosting win over reigning world champion, Heryanto Arbi from Indonesia, in the Sudirman Cup team championship last week, and is in a determined mood.

"It has been difficult to get motivated since the Olympics," said Hoyer-Larsen. "Last year, I was so focused on winning the three major titles. Once I had achieved it, it was easy to become too relaxed."
"But I now feel I am back mentally. I'm looking forward to the championships, and I definitely feel ready to win."
Hoyer-Larsen is seeded second here to Dong Jiong, the man who beat him at the semifinal stage of the All-England championships in March.
He is due to meet number five seed, Joko Suprianto from Indonesia, in the quarter-finals and number three seed, Sun Jun, in the semis.
